en_US.X0164: On October 9, 1989, 70,000 people protested peacefully in Leipzig against the SED regime. The state power capitulated in front of the unmanageable crowd: For the first time, the demonstration was able to circle the entire inner city ring of Leipzig. With far-reaching consequences. On October 13, Order 9/89 of the SED Politburo bans the use of firearms at demonstrations. A few days later, Erich Honecker must resign as general secretary of the SED.
